intro: Alectorolophus hayekii, commonly known as the Yemen sage, is a flowering plant native to Yemen. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in whorled clusters. Alectorolophus hayekii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
